summary: Dubai, the biggest city in the United Arab Emirates, has around 3.6 million people. Most of its residents are from other countries, working as expatriates. Originally a fishing village, Dubai transformed into a global trade and tourism hotspot in the 20th century. While oil money helped its growth, today Dubai's economy mainly relies on trade, tourism, and other services. It's famous for its luxurious hotels and the Burj Khalifa, the world's tallest building. Located on the Persian Gulf, Dubai is a top travel destination, welcoming millions of visitors each year.
title: Dubai
